thread.title: Clinton Faces Sanders, Others in First Democratic Presidential Debate
thread.title_full: Clinton Faces Sanders, Others in First Democratic Presidential Debate - CBN.com

author: CBNNews.com
title: Clinton Faces Sanders, Others in First Democratic Presidential Debate
text:
The Democrats' first presidential debate, hosted by CNN, takes place in Las Vegas Tuesday night, with five candidates hoping to prove to the American public they can lead their party in the White House for a third straight term.
Presidential hopefuls Hillary Rodham Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont are joined by former Maryland Gov. Martin O'Malley; former Navy Secretary and U.S. senator Jim Webb; and, former Rhode Island governor and U.S. senator Lincoln Chafee.
Click here to watch CNN's live stream of the debate.
Clinton seeks to move past her email woes. Maria Cardona, a Democratic strategist who worked for Clinton's 2008 White House campaign said "this will be a win for her no matter how you look at it," as long as the issue of Clinton's email doesn't dominate the debate.
Sanders hopes to broaden his appeal, and poses the biggest challenge to the weakened front-runner and former secretary-of-state Clinton. Sanders has energized liberals with his call for a "political revolution."
Much of the focus of the debate will be how Clinton and Sanders engage one another. Both have gone long stretches in the campaign without mentioning each other's names.
Follow @TheBrodyFile and @AmberCStrong to get live updates from the debate.
